alert.note: Alert for Chouteau (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 4:42PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Hill and north central Chouteau Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 441 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles west of Big Sandy, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of water on roadways will cause difficult driving on rural roads. Locations impacted include... Big Sandy, Azure, Sangrey, Boneau, Box Elder, Agency, Kenilworth, Kremlin and Laredo. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 360 and 370. Highway 87 between mile markers 79 and 103. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM MDT for north central Montana.
